text: Then they came near him and said, “We will build safe places for our flocks here, and cities for our little ones.
speaker: Narrator

text: But we will be ready for battle and will go with the people of Israel until we have brought them to their place. Our little ones will live within the walls of the cities because of the people who live in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: We will not return to our homes until every one of the people of Israel has received his land.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we will not have any land among them on the other side of the Jordan. Our land has come to us on this side of the Jordan toward the east.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses said to them, “Do as you say. Get ready for war before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: All of you men of war cross over the Jordan before the Lord until He has driven away those who fight against Him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and has won the land in battle. Then after this you may return because you have done your duty to the Lord and to Israel. This land will be your land before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if you do not do as you say, you have sinned against the Lord. And for sure you will be punished for your sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Build cities for your little ones and places for your sheep. Then do what you have promised.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Gad and the sons of Reuben said to Moses, “Your servants will do just as my lord says.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our little ones, our wives, our flocks and all our cattle will stay there in the cities of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: But your servants, everyone who is ready for war, will cross over before the Lord to battle, just as my lord says.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses gave news about them to Eleazar the religious leader, Joshua the son of Nun, and to the heads of the fathers’ houses of the families of the people of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said to them, “The sons of Gad and the sons of Reuben, every man ready for battle, are to cross with you over the Jordan before the Lord, and the land will be won. After this, you must give them the land of Gilead for their own.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if they will not cross over with you ready for battle, their land must be among you in the land of Canaan.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Gad and the sons of Reuben answered, “We will do as the Lord has said to your servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: We will cross over into the land of Canaan ready for battle before the Lord. And the land on this side of the Jordan will be ours.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses gave the nations of Sihon king of the Amorites and Og king of Bashan to the sons of Gad and the sons of Reuben and the half-family group of Joseph’s son Manasseh. He gave them the land, with its cities and the country around them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the sons of Gad built Dibon, Ataroth, Aroer,
speaker: Narrator

text: Atrothshophan, Jazer, Jogbehah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Bethnimrah and Beth-haran, cities with walls around them. And they made safe places for their sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Reuben built Heshbon, Elealeh, Kiriathaim,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nebo and Baal-meon (their names to be changed), and Sibmah. And they gave other names to the cities they built.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Manasseh’s son Machir went to Gilead and took it. They drove away the Amorites who were in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses gave Gilead to Machir the son of Manasseh, and he lived in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jair the son of Manasseh went and took its towns, and called them Havvoth-jair.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nobah went and took Kenath and its towns, and called it Nobah after his own name.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the travels of the people of Israel, when Moses and Aaron led them out from the land of Egypt by their armies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses wrote down the starting places of their travels, as the Lord told him. These are their travels by their starting places.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Rameses on the fifteenth day of the first month. On the day after the Passover the people of Israel started out strong in heart in front of all the Egyptians.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Egyptians were burying all their first-born whom the Lord had killed among them. The Lord had punished their gods also.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the people of Israel traveled from Rameses and stayed in Succoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Succoth and stayed in Etham, beside the desert.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went from Etham and turned back to Pi-hahiroth, east of Baal-zephon, and stayed at Migdol.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they traveled from Hahiroth and passed through the sea into the desert. They traveled for three days in the desert of Etham, and stayed at Marah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They left Marah and came to Elim. There were twelve wells of water and seventy palm trees in Elim, and they stayed there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they traveled from Elim and stayed by the Red Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: They left the Red Sea and stayed in the Desert of Sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from the Desert of Sin, and stayed at Dophkah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they left Dophkah and stayed at Alush.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Alush and stayed at Rephidim. It was there that the people had no water to drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went from Rephidim and stayed in the Desert of Sinai.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from the Desert of Sinai, and stayed at Kibroth-hattaavah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went from Kibroth-hattaavah and stayed at Hazeroth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They left Hazeroth and stayed at Rithmah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they went from Rithmah and stayed at Rimmon-perez.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Rimmon-perez, and stayed at Libnah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They left Libnah, and stayed at Rissah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they went from Rissah and stayed at Kehelathah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went from Kehelathah and stayed at Mount Shepher.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Mount Shepher and stayed at Haradah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They left Haradah and stayed at Makheloth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they traveled from Makheloth, and stayed at Tahath.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Tahath, and stayed at Terah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went from Terah and stayed at Mithkah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They left Mithkah and stayed at Hashmonah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they left Hashmonah and stayed at Moseroth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went from Moseroth and stayed at Benejaakan.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Benejaakan, and stayed at Hor-haggidgad.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went from Hor-haggidgad and stayed at Jotbathah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they left Jotbathah and stayed at Abronah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went from Abronah and stayed at Ezion-geber.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went from Ezion-geber and stayed in the Desert of Zin, that is, Kadesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they traveled from Kadesh, and stayed at Mount Hor, beside the land of Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Aaron the religious leader went up to Mount Hor, as the Lord told him. He died there, in the fortieth year after the people of Israel had left the land of Egypt, on the first day of the fifth month.
speaker: Narrator

text: Aaron was 123 years old when he died on Mount Hor.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Canaanite king of Arad, who lived in the Negev in the land of Canaan, heard of the coming of the people of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the people traveled from Mount Hor, and stayed at Zalmonah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They left Zalmonah, and stayed at Punon.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went from Punon and stayed at Oboth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they left Oboth and stayed at Iye-abarim, beside Moab.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from Iyim, and stayed at Dibon-gad.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went from Dibon-gad and stayed at Almon-diblathaim.
speaker: Narrator

text: They left Almon-diblathaim and stayed in the mountains of Abarim, near Nebo.
speaker: Narrator

text: They traveled from the mountains of Abarim, and stayed in the plains of Moab by the Jordan near Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they stayed by the Jordan, from Beth-jeshimoth as far as Abelshittim in the plains of Moab.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to Moses in the plains of Moab by the Jordan near Jericho,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Say to the people of Israel, ‘You will cross over the Jordan into the land of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then drive out all the people living in the land in front of you. Destroy all their cut stones, and all their man-made gods, and all their high places.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take the land for your own and live in it. For I have given the land to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your families will receive land by drawing names. The larger families should be given more land. The smaller families should be given less land. When a man’s name is drawn, that land will be his. You will receive land by the family groups of your fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Drive out the people who live in the land in front of you. If you do not, then those who are allowed to stay will be like sharp pieces in your eyes and like thorns in your sides. They will trouble you in the land where you live.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will do to you as I thought to do to them.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to Moses,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Tell the people of Israel, ‘When you go into the land of Canaan, this is the land that will be given to you, all the land of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your south side will be from the Desert of Zin along the side of Edom. It will go east from the end of the Salt Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the side of your land will turn from the south up to the pass of Akrabbim and on to Zin. Its end will be south of Kadesh-barnea. It will go to Hazaraddar and on to Azmon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then it will turn from Azmon to the river of Egypt, and will end at the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘The west side of your land will be the shore of the Great Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Your north side will be from the Great Sea to Mount Hor.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it will go from Mount Hor to the Lebohamath, and end at Zedad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then it will go to Ziphron and end at Hazer-enan. This will be the north side.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘The east side of your land will be from Hazer-enan to Shepham,
speaker: Narrator

text: then down from Shepham to Riblah on the east side of Ain. Then it will go down to the hill on the east side of the Sea of Chinnereth.
speaker: Narrator

text: It will go down to the Jordan and end at the Salt Sea. This will be the sides all around your land.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses told the people of Israel, “This is the land you will receive by drawing names, which the Lord has said should be given to the nine and a half-family groups.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the sons of Reuben have received their land by their fathers’ houses. The sons of Gad have received theirs by their fathers’ houses. And the half-family group of Manasseh has received their land.
speaker: Narrator

text: The two and a half-family groups have received their land on the other side of the Jordan from Jericho, toward the east.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Eleazar the religious leader and Joshua the son of Nun are the men who will divide the land to be given to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And take one leader of every family group to divide the land among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of the men. Take Caleb the son of Jephunneh of the family group of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take Samuel the son of Ammihud of the family group of the sons of Simeon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take Elidad the son of Chislon of the family group of Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take Bukki the son of Jogli as the leader of the family group of the sons of Dan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the sons of Joseph, take Hanniel the son of Ephod as the leader of the family group of the sons of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take Kemuel the son of Shiphtan as the leader of the family group of the sons of Ephraim.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take Elizaphan the son of Parnach as the leader of the family group of the sons of Zebulun.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take Paltiel the son of Azzan as the leader of the family group of the sons of Issachar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take Ahihud the son of Shelomi as the leader of the family group of the sons of Asher.
speaker: Narrator

text: And take Pedahel the son of Ammihud as the leader of the family group of the sons of Naphtali.”
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the men whom the Lord told to divide the land among the people of Israel in the land of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses in the plains of Moab by the Jordan near Jericho,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Tell the people of Israel to give the Levites cities to live in from the land they receive. And give the Levites fields around the cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cities will be theirs to live in. Their fields will be for their cattle and flocks and for all their animals.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fields you give the Levites should be around the cities, from the city walls out 500 long steps.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you should number 1,000 long steps from the city on the east side, on the south side, on the west side, and on the north side, with the city in the center. These fields around the cities will belong to them for their animals.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cities you give the Levites will be the six cities where people can go to be safe. They will be where a man may run to if he has killed another person. And give them forty-two other cities, added to these.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give forty-eight cities in all to the Levites, together with their fields.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take more cities from the larger families of Israel to give to the Levites. And take less cities from the smaller families. Each should give some of its cities to the Levites by how much land is received.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to Moses,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Say to the people of Israel, ‘When you cross the Jordan into the land of Canaan,
speaker: Narrator

text: choose which cities are to be the ones where you can run to be safe. The man who has killed a person without meaning to may run there.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cities will be a safe place for you from the one who wants to punish you. So the one who has killed a person may not die until the people decide if he is guilty or not.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cities you give will be your six cities where you can go to be safe.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give three cities on the east side of the Jordan and three cities in the land of Canaan. They will be the cities where you can go to be safe.
speaker: Narrator

text: These six cities will be safe places for the people of Israel and for the stranger and for the one who visits them. Anyone who kills a person without meaning to may run there.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘But if he killed him with an iron object, then he is guilty. For sure the killer will be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: If he knocked him down with a stone so that he died, he is guilty. For sure the killer will be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Or if he hit him with a piece of wood in his hand so that he died, he is guilty. For sure the killer will be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: The man who wants to punish him for the killing will put the killer to death. He will put him to death when he meets him.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the killer has pushed him because he hated him, or has thrown something at him after waiting for him, and because of this he died,
speaker: Narrator

text: or if he hit him down with his hand because he hated him and killed him, for sure the one who killed him must be put to death. He is guilty. The man who wants to punish him for the killing will put him to death when he meets him.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘But if he pushed him without planning to and without hating him, or threw something at him without having waited for him,
speaker: Narrator

text: or he threw a stone without seeing him, killing him without hating him or meaning to hurt him,
speaker: Narrator

text: then the people will decide by these Laws between the killer and the one who wants to punish him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people will save the killer from the man who wants to punish him. And they will return him to his city where he had gone to be safe. He will live in it until the death of the head religious leader who was set apart with the holy oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if the man who killed another person at sometime goes outside his city where he went to be safe,
speaker: Narrator

text: then the man who wants to punish him will not be guilty of blood if he finds him outside the safe city and kills him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because the man should have stayed in his city to be safe until the death of the head religious leader. But after the head religious leader dies, the man who killed another person may return to his own land.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘These things will be a Law to you and to all your children-to-come in all your homes.
speaker: Narrator

text: If anyone kills a person, the killer must be put to death by what is told by those who saw the killing. But no person may be put to death because of what one person says.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must not take pay to save the life of a killer who is guilty of death. But he must be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must not take pay for him who has run to his city to be safe, so that he may return to live in the land before the death of the religious leader.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must not make the land where you live unclean. The land is not holy when people are killed. And only the blood of him who is guilty can pay to make the land free from the blood that has fallen on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not make the land where you live unclean, in the place where I live. For I the Lord am living among the people of Israel.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: The heads of the fathers’ houses of the family group of the sons of Gilead the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, of the families of the sons of Joseph, came near. They spoke in front of Moses and the leaders, the heads of the fathers’ houses of the people of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said, “The Lord told my lord to give the land to the people of Israel by drawing names. And my lord was told by the Lord to give the land of our brother Zelophehad to his daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if they marry one of the sons of the other family groups of Israel, then their land would be taken away from what was given to our fathers and would be added to the land of the family group they marry into. So it would be taken from the land that had been given to us.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Year of Jubilee of the people of Israel comes, their land will be added to the land of the family group into which they marry. So their land will be taken from the land of the family group of our fathers.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses told the people of Israel what the Lord said. He said, “The family group of the sons of Joseph are right in what they say.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is what the Lord has said about the daughters of Zelophehad: ‘Let them marry whom they think best. Only they must marry within the family group of their father.’
speaker: Narrator

text: This way no land of the people of Israel will go from one family group to another. The people of Israel will each hold to the land of the family group of his fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every daughter who comes to own the land of any family group of Israel, must be the wife of one of her father’s family group. So every one of the people of Israel may own the land of his fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: No land will go from one family group to another. For the families of Israel will each hold to his own land.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The daughters of Zelophehad did just as the Lord had told Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah and Noah, the daughters of Zelophehad, married sons of their father’s brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text: They married into the families of the sons of Manasseh the son of Joseph. And their land stayed with their father’s family group.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the Laws which the Lord told the people of Israel through Moses in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho.
speaker: Narrator
